entries.content: Today's economics class was complex, but I managed to understand it. I'm a bit worried about next week's report.
Had lunch at the cafeteria with my friends Ken and Aya. We had curry and got excited talking about summer vacation plans, endlessly debating whether to go to the beach or the mountains.

Started my shift at the convenience store near the station. Our regular customer Mr. Suzuki came in and said, 'You're always working hard!' It was a small thing, but it made me so happy that all my fatigue disappeared.
